newsitem.title: USA: GM Hughes sees role in defense consolidation.
newsitem.headline: GM Hughes sees role in defense consolidation.

text.p: The chairman General Motors Corp's Hughes Electronics Corp subsidiary said Wednesday that Hughes must be a part of the consolidation now sweeping the U.S. defense industry.
C. Michael Armstrong, speaking to the Economic Club of Detroit, declined to comment directly on the possible sale of Hughes' defense operations.
However, asked if an announcement regarding Hughes' future is a long time away, Armstrong said, "If this went months, I'd be in big trouble."
GM Chairman Jack Smith, who also attended Armstrong's speech, told reporters not to expect an announcement regarding Hughes today.
He has said previously that GM is trying to get "top dollar" in bidding for the Hughes defense operations.

Armstrong said the defense industry needs to continue to consolidate because of the shrinking post-Cold War defense budgets and the need to become more competitive developing defense systems at lower costs.
"The industry must continue to consolidate. Hughes must participate in that consolidation," he said.
Previously, Hughes has chosen to acquire other defense firms as part of the consolidation, he said.
"In order to serve both the country, our sharholders and employees, we're going to have to do more," said Armstrong, declining to specify if he was referring to more acquisitions or divestitures.
